prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Kay Faraday
Description: Young girl purporting to be the 2nd Yatagarasu. She's on the trail of her father's killer.
Character 1
Name: Byrne Faraday
Description: Father of Kay, and admirable prosecutor, he was killed 7 years ago by Calisto Yew
Character 2
Name: Calisto Yew
Description: Killed Kay's father 7 years ago. Claimed to be Yatagarasu and then made her escape.
Character 3
Name: Dick Gumshoe
Description: Homicide detective at the local precinct. In charge of the initial investigation.
Character 4
Name: Shih-na
Description: Lang's trusty secretary. Level-headed, she supports him in his investigations.
Character 5
Name: Franziska von Karma
Description: Daughter of my mentor, Manfred von Karma. Cooperating w/ Interpol on smuggling case.
Character 6
Name: Colias Palaeno
Description: Ambassador of Babahl who will do absolutely everything for his country's tourism industry.
Character 7
Name: Manny Coachen
Description: The victim. Amb. Palaeno's secretary and secretariat. Apparently, was a good man.
Character 8
Name: Shi-Long Lang
Description: Boasts he has the highest arrest rate in Interpol. He is after the smuggling ring.
Character 9
Name: Quercus Alba
Description: Ambassador of Allebahst. Also retired army man. May explain why overly-harsh on himself.
Character 10
Name: Larry Butz
Description: The man under the Steel Samurai mask. Sadly, he is a friend from grade school.
Character 11
Name: Tyrell Badd
Description: Eagle-eyed homicide det. His partner was killed 7 yrs. ago. He's here after Calisto Yew.
Character 12
Name: Mask☆DeMasque II
Description: Opportunist unrelated to 1st DeMasque. Found in Allebahst. Real name: Ka-Shi Nou.
Character 13
Name: Ex-Security Lady
Description: The woman behind the Pink Princess mask. I believe her real name is Wendy Oldbag.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Prosecutor's Badge
Description: Proof of my profession. However, I prefer to keep it in my pocket.
Evidence 1
Name: Embassy Guide
Description: Two countries share this building with borders.
Evidence 2
Name: Steel Samurai's Autograph
Description: Autograph with a sketch of his face and weapon.
Evidence 3
Name: Notes on Coachen's Body
Description: COD: single stab to base of neck. The body wasn't badly burnt by the fire.
Evidence 4
Name: Yatagarasu's Key
Description: The Yatagarasu stole this from this embassy 7 years ago. It is also a knife.
Evidence 5
Name: Knife
Description: Covered in victim's blood, the blade matches the wound. Butterfly motif is noteworthy. [caption] The blade is red with blood, while the handle with the butterfly motif is completely clean. 1 of a set of 3 ornamental knives. Covered in victim's blood, blade same as wound. The blade is definitely Allebahstian. Was this carried across country lines? Blade determined to be Allebahstian. The flower motif's petals are separate.
Evidence 6
Name: Babahl's Primidux Statue
Description: Both countries claim to own real one. Nat. treasure. Only Amb. and Secret. can touch. It was a fake, but was swapped with the real one. Is originally from Allebahst.
Evidence 7
Name: Cohdopian Paper Document
Description: Accounting doc related to smuggling. Proof someone in 1 of the countries is ringleader. Doc related to smuggling of Babahlese ink. It appears to point to Mr. Coachen.
Edgeworth:
Take a good look at these documents, Franziska.
Franziska:
It says that there are three pages in total, and yet, there are only two here.
Edgeworth:
Correct. Now take a look at the smuggling activity document in your possession. Tell me, is it not possible that your page was taken from this set of three?
Franziska:
Well, well... It certainly looks that way.
Edgeworth:
By putting our multi-part puzzle together, we seem to have arrived at an answer. And it seems that you have now found what you were looking for.
Franziska:
Yes, and with this, it has become crystal clear... ...that Mr. Coachen himself was responsible for the mass smuggling of Babahlese ink!
Evidence 8
Name: Babahlese Knife Handle
Description: Swapped with the real murder weapon's handle, its blade has yet to be found.
Evidence 9
Name: Counterfeit Bills
Description: Made with Babahlese ink, they are in circulation in Zheng Fa. It's hard to tell they're fake. Bills circulating in Zheng Fa. Made by Coachen. They were all burned up in Babahl.
Evidence 10
Name: Babahlese Ink
Description: Special whitcrystal oil-based ink. Limited export because of some specific reason. Special whitcrystal oil-based ink. Limited export because of its use in counterfeiting.
Evidence 11
Name: DeMasque II's Note
Description: Request for the theft of the Primidux Statue with a map to where the statue is. Request to steal the Primidux Statue. Same shape as notepad in Babahl office. Request to steal the Primidux Statue. Handwriting matches that of Manny Coachen.
Evidence 12
Name: Samurai Sword
Description: Weapon that's used on stage. Is thought to be what killed DeMasque II.
Evidence 13
Name: Photo with Steel Samurai
Description: Taken in front of Allebahst's Statue before murder.
Evidence 14
Name: Passionflowers
Description: Two large flowers in bloom. The vines are supported by stakes and are still growing. Two large flowers in bloom. Ambassador Alba takes great care in growing them.
Evidence 15
Name: Samurai Spear
Description: Weapon that's used on stage. Larry hit it against a wall and bent it. It's hollow. Because he bent it, Larry couldn't do the "Early Summer Rain Jab!" special attack.
Evidence 16
Name: Allebahst's Primidux Statue
Description: Both countries claim to own real one. Nat. treasure. Only Amb. and Secret. can touch. Both countries claim to own real one. Nat. treasure. Signs it was moved during murder. Bloodstained weapon used to kill DeMasque. Originally from Babahl's secretariat's office. Used to be real, but has been swapped with a fake from Babahl. Was used as a weapon.
Evidence 17
Name: Stand-In Request
Description: Request for Ms. Oldbag to stand in for Mindy, the Pink Princess actress who fell ill.
Evidence 18
Name: Letter from a Stalker
Description: For Ms. Oldbag. Has mistakes from bad penmanship.
Evidence 19
Name: Lady's Undershirt
Description: Found in office fireplace. There's only 1 person here who would own such a shirt. Found in office fireplace. Ms. Oldbag was drying it in the fireplace next door.
Evidence 20
Name: Samurai Dogs
Description: Present for embassy staff. Ms. Oldbag took and ate a few from the dressing room.
Evidence 21
Name: Silhouette Lantern
Description: Runs on whitcrystal oil, which burns green. It's a Babahlese souvenir.
Evidence 22
Name: Pick
Description: Found at the Open-Air Stage, it looks like a guitar pick. It's also wet for some reason.
Evidence 23
Name: Ms. Yew's Perfume
Description: This was left behind by Calisto Yew 7 years ago. Kay has been safe-guarding it.
Evidence 24
Name: Fountain Spouts
Description: Part of the Rose Garden pool. Auto-refills the water when the water level is too low.
Evidence 25
Name: Photo of Yatagarasu
Description: Taken from a building nearby at the moment of border crossing during the fire. Photo taken after the first fire on the 4th and 5th floors had taken place.
Evidence 26
Name: Fires in Babahl
Description: Two fires broke out in Babahl today.
Evidence 27
Name: Amb. Palaeno's Testimony
Description: Spilled Babahlese ink onto back wall while burning files in fireplace. Left ashes there.
Evidence 28
Name: Wire
Description: A good length of wire that was found wound up inside Babahl's grandfather clock.
Evidence 29
Name: Revolving Fireplace Wall
Description: There are signs that the revolving fireplace wall on Babahl's side has been used.
Evidence 30
Name: Hair Sticks → Crossbow Arrows
Description: Hair sticks with a candy stripe pattern on them. There is some dirt on the tips. Thought to be hair sticks, they're passionflower support stakes from Allebahst office. Neither hair sticks nor support stakes, they're actually crossbow arrows.
Evidence 31
Name: Trump Card
Description: Evidence from KG-8. Card containing orders from boss of smuggling ring to Coachen.
Evidence 32
Name: Video Tape
Description: Evidence from KG-8. Faraday had obtained it once, but Ernest Amano had it stolen. Evidence from KG-8. Footage showing Coachen entering the KG-8 Incident's crime scene.
Evidence 33
Name: Counterfeit Plate
Description: This was found from within the fake Primidux Statue Alba smuggled into his country.
Evidence 34
Name: Amb. Alba's Wound
Description: Mr. Alba claims it's proof he was stabbed by DeMasque II, so it was justified defence.
Evidence 35
Name: Commemorative Photo
Description: Taken at Theatrum Neutralis. The murder weapon can be seen in Mr. Alba's bouquet.
Evidence 36
Name: Security Footage
Description: Footage of the entranceways into Babahl and Allebahst from the Theatrum Neutralis.
Evidence 37
Name: Pushcart
Description: Steel Samural pushed this to Allebahst from the dressing room. The bulge is unnatural. Steel Samurai pushed this to Allebahst from the dressing room. There is blood inside.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: Even your police confirmed that the Yatagarasu infiltrated the Babahlese embassy tonight.
Person: Shih-na
Testimony 1
Testimony: Utilizing the confusion caused by the fire, the Yatagarasu snuck into this embassy.
Person: Shih-na
Testimony 2
Testimony: Furthermore, this girl claims to be the Yatagarasu.
Person: Shih-na
Testimony 3
Testimony: She wanted to steal documents regarding smuggling, so she killed Mr. Coachen for the key.
Person: Shih-na
Testimony 4
Testimony: And most importantly, other than her, there was no one else in here with the body.
Person: Shih-na

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, let's see. I need to find which evidence contradicts one of the testimonies provided. The testimonies are from Shih-na, and the key points are that Kay Faraday, as the Yatagarasu, killed Coachen to steal smuggling documents, and that no one else was in the room with the body.

Looking at the evidence, Evidence 3 (Notes on Coachen's Body) states that the cause of death was a single stab to the base of the neck, and the body wasn't badly burnt. The murder weapon is Evidence 5, the Knife, which is covered in blood but the handle is clean with a butterfly motif. The blade is Allebahstian. 

Testimony 3 says that Kay killed Coachen to get the key for smuggling documents. However, if the knife used is from Allebahst, and considering the characters, Kay is associated with the Yatagarasu key (Evidence 4) which is a knife stolen from the embassy. But the murder weapon here (Evidence 5) has a butterfly motif, which might link to someone else. Also, Evidence 11 (DeMasque II's Note) has a request with Coachen's handwriting, implying he was involved in the theft. Then, Evidence 31 (Trump Card) is an order from the smuggling boss to Coachen, and Evidence 32 (Video Tape) shows Coachen at the KG-8 Incident, suggesting he was part of the smuggling ring. 

Wait, Shih-na's testimony 3 claims Kay killed Coachen to steal the key. But if Coachen himself was involved in smuggling (as per Evidence 7, Cohdopian Paper Document), and Evidence 11 shows Coachen wrote the theft request, maybe Coachen was the one orchestrating things. Also, Evidence 7 says the document points to Coachen as the ringleader, so if he's already the smuggler, why would Kay need to kill him for documents? That might be a contradiction. But how does that tie into evidence and testimony?

Alternatively, looking at Testimony 4: "no one else was in here with the body." But if there's evidence that someone else could have been present. For example, the revolving fireplace (Evidence 29) or the security footage (Evidence 36) might show others. Or maybe the murder weapon's origin. Wait, the knife (Evidence 5) is Allebahstian, which is Ambassador Alba's country. If the killer had to bring the knife across borders, but the embassy is shared. But Shih-na claims Kay did it alone. If the knife is from Allebahst, maybe someone from that side, like Alba, could have accessed it. 

But the key contradiction might be between Testimony 3 (Kay killed Coachen for the key) and Evidence 4 (Yatagarasu's Key). Wait, Evidence 4 is the key that was stolen 7 years ago by Yatagarasu (Calisto Yew). The current murder's key? Or maybe the key in Evidence 4 is a different one. Also, Evidence 5 (the Knife) is the murder weapon. If the handle is clean, maybe the killer wore gloves, which Kay might not have. But the blade being from Allebahst might imply the killer is from there, contradicting Shih-na's claim that Kay did it. So if the murder weapon is from Allebahst, and Kay is from Babahl's side, she might not have access. Therefore, Testimony 3 claims Kay killed him with the key (Evidence 4), but the actual murder weapon is Evidence 5, which is an Allebahstian knife. That would be a contradiction. So the evidence (5) shows the murder weapon is from Allebahst, but Shih-na's testimony (3) says Kay, who is the Yatagarasu (Babahl's side), used her key (Evidence 4) to kill him. But the knife used is from Allebahst, which Kay wouldn't have, thus contradicting the testimony.

Testimony 3

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, let's tackle this problem. So, I need to find which evidence contradicts one of the testimonies provided by Shih-na. Let's start by reviewing the testimonies and then check the evidences to see where there's a conflict.

Testimony 0: The knife wound matches the blade of the knife. That seems straightforward, but let's look at the evidence related to the knife. Evidence 5 is the Knife. The description says the blade is covered in blood and matches the wound, but the handle with the butterfly motif is clean. Wait, but the testimony says the knife with the butterfly handle is the murder weapon. However, Evidence 5 mentions that the handle was swapped with the real murder weapon's handle. So the actual murder weapon's handle is different? That could be a contradiction. Because Shih-na claims the butterfly-handled knife is the murder weapon, but the evidence indicates the handle was swapped. So the real murder weapon's handle isn't the butterfly one. Therefore, Testimony 1 says the butterfly handle knife is the murder weapon, but Evidence 5 says the handle was swapped, implying the handle isn't the original. So the murder weapon's handle isn't the butterfly one, contradicting the testimony. 

Looking at Testimony 1 specifically: "The knife with the butterfly handle is the murder weapon, which the killer was holding." But Evidence 5 states that the handle was swapped. So the actual murder weapon would have a different handle, making the butterfly handle not part of the real weapon. Therefore, Shih-na's Testimony 1 is contradicted by Evidence 5. 

Wait, but Testimony 0 says the blade matches the wound, which Evidence 5 confirms. So Testimony 0 is correct. Testimony 1 is about the handle. So the contradiction is between Testimony 1 and Evidence 5. Because the knife's handle (butterfly) is clean and was swapped, meaning the murder weapon's handle isn't the butterfly one. Therefore, Shih-na's assertion that the butterfly-handled knife is the murder weapon is incorrect. 

So the pair would be Evidence 5 contradicting Testimony 1. But looking at the testimonies, Testimony 1 is by Shih-na. The JSON requires the evidence number and testimony number. Evidence 5 is the Knife, and Testimony 1 is Shih-na's statement about the butterfly handle being the murder weapon. Therefore, {"evidence":5, "testimony":1}.

Name: Samurai Spear
Description: Weapon that's used on stage. Larry hit it against a wall and bent it. It's hollow. Because he bent it, Larry couldn't do the "Early Summer Rain Jab!" special attack.
Evidence 16
Name: Allebahst's Primidux Statue
Description: Both countries claim to own real one. Nat. treasure. Only Amb. and Secret. can touch. Both countries claim to own real one. Nat. treasure. Signs it was moved during murder. Bloodstained weapon used to kill DeMasque. Originally from Babahl's secretariat's office. Used to be real, but has been swapped with a fake from Babahl. Was used as a weapon.
Evidence 17
Name: Stand-In Request
Description: Request for Ms. Oldbag to stand in for Mindy, the Pink Princess actress who fell ill.
Evidence 18
Name: Letter from a Stalker
Description: For Ms. Oldbag. Has mistakes from bad penmanship.
Evidence 19
Name: Lady's Undershirt
Description: Found in office fireplace. There's only 1 person here who would own such a shirt. Found in office fireplace. Ms. Oldbag was drying it in the fireplace next door.
Evidence 20
Name: Samurai Dogs
Description: Present for embassy staff. Ms. Oldbag took and ate a few from the dressing room.
Evidence 21
Name: Silhouette Lantern
Description: Runs on whitcrystal oil, which burns green. It's a Babahlese souvenir.
Evidence 22
Name: Pick
Description: Found at the Open-Air Stage, it looks like a guitar pick. It's also wet for some reason.
Evidence 23
Name: Ms. Yew's Perfume
Description: This was left behind by Calisto Yew 7 years ago. Kay has been safe-guarding it.
Evidence 24
Name: Fountain Spouts
Description: Part of the Rose Garden pool. Auto-refills the water when the water level is too low.
Evidence 25
Name: Photo of Yatagarasu
Description: Taken from a building nearby at the moment of border crossing during the fire. Photo taken after the first fire on the 4th and 5th floors had taken place.
Evidence 26
Name: Fires in Babahl
Description: Two fires broke out in Babahl today.
Evidence 27
Name: Amb. Palaeno's Testimony
Description: Spilled Babahlese ink onto back wall while burning files in fireplace. Left ashes there.
Evidence 28
Name: Wire
Description: A good length of wire that was found wound up inside Babahl's grandfather clock.
Evidence 29
Name: Revolving Fireplace Wall
Description: There are signs that the revolving fireplace wall on Babahl's side has been used.
Evidence 30
Name: Hair Sticks → Crossbow Arrows
Description: Hair sticks with a candy stripe pattern on them. There is some dirt on the tips. Thought to be hair sticks, they're passionflower support stakes from Allebahst office. Neither hair sticks nor support stakes, they're actually crossbow arrows.

Name: Trump Card
Description: Evidence from KG-8. Card containing orders from boss of smuggling ring to Coachen.
Evidence 32
Name: Video Tape
Description: Evidence from KG-8. Faraday had obtained it once, but Ernest Amano had it stolen. Evidence from KG-8. Footage showing Coachen entering the KG-8 Incident's crime scene.
Evidence 33
Name: Counterfeit Plate
Description: This was found from within the fake Primidux Statue Alba smuggled into his country.
Evidence 34
Name: Amb. Alba's Wound
Description: Mr. Alba claims it's proof he was stabbed by DeMasque II, so it was justified defence.
Evidence 35
Name: Commemorative Photo
Description: Taken at Theatrum Neutralis. The murder weapon can be seen in Mr. Alba's bouquet.
Evidence 36
Name: Security Footage
Description: Footage of the entranceways into Babahl and Allebahst from the Theatrum Neutralis.
Evidence 37
Name: Pushcart
Description: Steel Samural pushed this to Allebahst from the dressing room. The bulge is unnatural. Steel Samurai pushed this to Allebahst from the dressing room. There is blood inside.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: I was the one who found the body of the victim, DeMasque II.
Person: Lang
Testimony 1
Testimony: Beside him was the Samurai Sword... glittering red, and offering up the scent of blood.
Person: Lang
Testimony 2
Testimony: Beside him was the Samurai Sword... covered in the victim's blood.
Person: Lang
Testimony 3
Testimony: I suspect he beat the victim to death with that thing.
Person: Lang
Testimony 4
Testimony: It was supposed to be in the Steel Samurai's dressing room, but I found it here instead.
Person: Lang
Testimony 5
Testimony: Plus, I found the murder weapon's owner, the suspect, Larry Butz in here, too.
Person: Lang

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, let's start by looking through the testimonies provided by Lang. Testimony 3 says he suspects Larry beat the victim to death with the Samurai Sword. But looking at the evidence related to the murder weapon, Evidence 5 is the Knife, which is covered in the victim's blood and matches the wound. The cause of death in Evidence 3 is a single stab to the neck, not blunt force trauma from a sword. So if the COD is a stab wound from the knife, then Testimony 3 suggesting the sword was the murder weapon contradicts that. The sword (Evidence 12) is thought to have killed DeMasque II, but the actual COD points to the knife. Therefore, the contradiction is between Testimony 3 and Evidence 3 or 5. However, Testimony 3 specifically refers to beating to death, which doesn't match the stab wound. So Evidence 3 (Notes on Coachen's Body) states the COD is a stab, contradicting Testimony 3's claim of beating with the sword. But wait, the testimonies from Lang (3) are about DeMasque II's murder. Wait, the victim in the testimonies is DeMasque II, right? Let me check.

Testimonies 0-5 are all by Lang regarding DeMasque II's murder. Testimony 3: "I suspect he beat the victim to death with that thing." The Samurai Sword (Evidence 12) is the supposed murder weapon here. But Evidence 3's COD is a single stab, but that's for Coachen's body. Wait, Evidence 3 is about Coachen's body, not DeMasque II. So maybe there's another COD for DeMasque II. Let me check Evidence 12: Samurai Sword is thought to be what killed DeMasque II. But Evidence 16 (Allebahst's Primidux Statue) says it was bloodstained and used as a weapon. Wait, this is getting confusing. Let me clarify.

The victim here in the testimonies is DeMasque II. The murder weapon according to Testimony 3 is the Samurai Sword (beaten to death), but the actual COD for DeMasque II might be different. Let's check Evidence 16: Allebahst's Primidux Statue was used as a weapon to kill DeMasque II. So if the statue was the actual weapon, then Lang's Testimony 3 about the sword contradicts Evidence 16. Alternatively, the Samurai Spear (Evidence 15) is bent, but that's another matter. Alternatively, Evidence 12 says the Samurai Sword is thought to be what killed DeMasque II, but if the actual weapon was the statue (Evidence 16), then Testimony 3 would be contradicted by Evidence 16. However, the testimonies are from Lang, who found the sword next to the body. But if the COD was a stabbing, then the sword might not have been the actual weapon. Alternatively, perhaps the sword's description (Evidence 12) says it's "thought to be what killed DeMasque II", but maybe there's another evidence that contradicts this. Let me check the other evidence.

Wait, the victim in the testimonies is DeMasque II, but the evidence for COD is split. For Coachen, it's Evidence 3 (stab). For DeMasque II, maybe the murder weapon is the statue (Evidence 16). So Testimony 3 suggests the sword was used to beat DeMasque II, but if the real weapon was the statue, then that's a contradiction. Therefore, the evidence contradicting Testimony 3 would be Evidence 16. But looking at the evidence list, Evidence 16 states that the Allebahst's Primidux Statue was used as a weapon. So if Lang says the sword was the murder weapon, but the statue was actually used, then Evidence 16 contradicts Testimony 3.

So the pair would be Testimony 3 and Evidence 16. But let me check the exact wording. Testimony 3: "I suspect he beat the victim to death with that thing (Samurai Sword)". Evidence 16: "Used to kill DeMasque II". So if the statue was the weapon, then Testimony 3 is contradicted. Therefore, {"evidence": 16, "testimony": 3}.

Wait, but Evidence 16's description says "bloodstained weapon used to kill DeMasque. Originally from Babahl's secretariat's office. Used to be real, but has been swapped with a fake from Babahl. Was used as a weapon." So the statue (Evidence 16) was the murder weapon, not the sword. Therefore, Lang's Testimony 3 (claiming the sword was the murder weapon) contradicts Evidence 16. That's the contradiction. So the answer would be evidence 16 and testimony 3.
